00026 #include "lpc17xx_ssp.h"
00027 #include "lpc17xx_libcfg.h"
00028 #include "lpc17xx_pinsel.h"
00029 #include "debug_frmwrk.h"
00030 #include "lpc17xx_gpio.h"

00032 /* Example group ----------------------------------------------------------- */
00039 /************************** PRIVATE DEFINITIONS ***********************/
00040 // PORT number that /CS pin assigned on
00041 #define CS_PORT_NUM             0
00042 // PIN number that  /CS pin assigned on
00043 #define CS_PIN_NUM              16
00044 
00045 // Define macro used in command when using SSP with SC16IS740
00046 #define SC16IS740_WR_CMD(x)             ((uint8_t) (x << 3))
00047 #define SC16IS740_RD_CMD(x)             ((uint8_t) ((x << 3) | 0x80))
00048 
00049 // Define register address of SC16IS740
00050 #define SC16IS740_IODIR_REG             0x0A
00051 #define SC16IS740_IOSTATE_REG   0x0B
00052 #define SC16IS740_IOCON_REG             0x0E
00053 
00054 
00055 /************************** PRIVATE VARIABLES *************************/
00056 uint8_t menu1[] =
00057 "********************************************************************************\n\r"
00058 "Hello NXP Semiconductors \n\r"
00059 "SSP demo \n\r"
00060 "\t - MCU: LPC17xx \n\r"
00061 "\t - Core: ARM Cortex-M3 \n\r"
00062 "\t - Communicate via: UART0 - 9.6 kbps \n\r"
00063 " Communicate with SSP0 function on SC16IS750/760 Demo Board\n\r"
00064 " in polling mode\n\r"
00065 " Use IO function on SC16IS740/750/760 chip to turn ON/OFF LEDs\n\r"
00066 " Press '1' to turn ON LEDs, '2' to turn OFF LEDs \n\r"
00067 "********************************************************************************\n\r";
00068 uint8_t menu2[] = "Demo terminated! \n\r";
00069 
00070 // SSP Configuration structure variable
00071 SSP_CFG_Type SSP_ConfigStruct;
00072 
00073 uint8_t iocon_cfg[2] = {SC16IS740_WR_CMD(SC16IS740_IOCON_REG), 0x00};
00074 uint8_t iodir_cfg[2] = {SC16IS740_WR_CMD(SC16IS740_IODIR_REG), 0xFF};
00075 uint8_t iostate_on[2] = {SC16IS740_WR_CMD(SC16IS740_IOSTATE_REG), 0x00};
00076 uint8_t iostate_off[2] = {SC16IS740_WR_CMD(SC16IS740_IOSTATE_REG), 0xFF};
00077 uint8_t sspreadbuf[2];
00078 
00079 /************************** PRIVATE FUNCTIONS *************************/
00080 void CS_Init(void);
00081 void CS_Force(int32_t state);
00082 void print_menu(void);
00083 
00084 /*-------------------------PRIVATE FUNCTIONS------------------------------*/
00085 /*********************************************************************/
00091 void CS_Init(void)
00092 {
00093         GPIO_SetDir(CS_PORT_NUM, (1<<CS_PIN_NUM), 1);
00094         GPIO_SetValue(CS_PORT_NUM, (1<<CS_PIN_NUM));
00095 }
00096 
00097 
00098 /*********************************************************************/
00106 void CS_Force(int32_t state)
00107 {
00108         if (state){
00109                 GPIO_SetValue(CS_PORT_NUM, (1<<CS_PIN_NUM));
00110         }else{
00111                 GPIO_ClearValue(CS_PORT_NUM, (1<<CS_PIN_NUM));
00112         }
00113 }
00114 
00115 
00116 /*********************************************************************/
00121 void print_menu(void)
00122 {
00123         _DBG(menu1);
00124 }
00125 
00126 /*-------------------------MAIN FUNCTION------------------------------*/
00127 /*********************************************************************/
00132 int c_entry(void)
00133 {
00134         uint8_t tmpchar[2] = {0, 0};
00135         PINSEL_CFG_Type PinCfg;
00136         __IO FlagStatus exitflag;
00137         SSP_DATA_SETUP_Type xferConfig;
00138 
00139         /*
00140          * Initialize SPI pin connect
00141          * P0.15 - SCK
00142          * P0.16 - SSEL - used as GPIO
00143          * P0.17 - MISO
00144          * P0.18 - MOSI
00145          */
00146         PinCfg.Funcnum = 2;
00147         PinCfg.OpenDrain = 0;
00148         PinCfg.Pinmode = 0;
00149         PinCfg.Portnum = 0;
00150         PinCfg.Pinnum = 15;
00151         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00152         PinCfg.Pinnum = 17;
00153         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00154         PinCfg.Pinnum = 18;
00155         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00156         PinCfg.Pinnum = 16;
00157         PinCfg.Funcnum = 0;
00158         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00159 
00160         /* Initialize debug via UART0
00161          * – 115200bps
00162          * – 8 data bit
00163          * – No parity
00164          * – 1 stop bit
00165          * – No flow control
00166          */
00167         debug_frmwrk_init();
00168 
00169         // print welcome screen
00170         print_menu();
00171 
00172         // initialize SSP configuration structure to default
00173         SSP_ConfigStructInit(&SSP_ConfigStruct);
00174         // Initialize SSP peripheral with parameter given in structure above
00175         SSP_Init(LPC_SSP0, &SSP_ConfigStruct);
00176 
00177         // Initialize /CS pin to GPIO function
00178         CS_Init();
00179 
00180         // Enable SSP peripheral
00181         SSP_Cmd(LPC_SSP0, ENABLE);
00182 
00183         /* First, send some command to reset SC16IS740 chip via SSP bus interface
00184          * note driver /CS pin to low state before transferring by CS_Enable() function
00185          */
00186         CS_Force(0);
00187         xferConfig.tx_data = iocon_cfg;
00188         xferConfig.rx_data = sspreadbuf;
00189         xferConfig.length = sizeof (iocon_cfg);
00190         SSP_ReadWrite(LPC_SSP0, &xferConfig, SSP_TRANSFER_POLLING);
00191         CS_Force(1);
00192 
00193         CS_Force(0);
00194         xferConfig.tx_data = iodir_cfg;
00195         xferConfig.rx_data = sspreadbuf;
00196         xferConfig.length = sizeof (iodir_cfg);
00197         SSP_ReadWrite(LPC_SSP0, &xferConfig, SSP_TRANSFER_POLLING);
00198         CS_Force(1);
00199 
00200         // Reset exit flag
00201         exitflag = RESET;
00202 
00203         /* Read some data from the buffer */
00204         while (exitflag == RESET)
00205         {
00206                 while((tmpchar[0] = _DG) == 0);
00207 
00208                 if (tmpchar[0] == 27){
00209                         /* ESC key, set exit flag */
00210                         _DBG_(menu2);
00211                         exitflag = SET;
00212                 }
00213                 else if (tmpchar[0] == 'r'){
00214                         print_menu();
00215                 } else {
00216                         if (tmpchar[0] == '1')
00217                         {
00218                                 // LEDs are ON now...
00219                                 CS_Force(0);
00220                                 xferConfig.tx_data = iostate_on;
00221                                 xferConfig.rx_data = sspreadbuf;
00222                                 xferConfig.length = sizeof (iostate_on);
00223                                 SSP_ReadWrite(LPC_SSP0, &xferConfig, SSP_TRANSFER_POLLING);
00224                                 CS_Force(1);
00225                         }
00226                         else if (tmpchar[0] == '2')
00227                         {
00228                                 // LEDs are OFF now...
00229                                 CS_Force(0);
00230                                 xferConfig.tx_data = iostate_off;
00231                                 xferConfig.rx_data = sspreadbuf;
00232                                 xferConfig.length = sizeof (iostate_off);
00233                                 SSP_ReadWrite(LPC_SSP0, &xferConfig, SSP_TRANSFER_POLLING);
00234                                 CS_Force(1);
00235                         }
00236                         /* Then Echo it back */
00237                         _DBG_(tmpchar);
00238                 }
00239         }
00240 
00241     // wait for current transmission complete - THR must be empty
00242     while (UART_CheckBusy(LPC_UART0) == SET);
00243 
00244     // DeInitialize UART0 peripheral
00245     UART_DeInit(LPC_UART0);
00246 
00247     /* Loop forever */
00248     while(1);
00249     return 1;
00250 }
00251 
00252 /* With ARM and GHS toolsets, the entry point is main() - this will
00253    allow the linker to generate wrapper code to setup stacks, allocate
00254    heap area, and initialize and copy code and data segments. For GNU
00255    toolsets, the entry point is through __start() in the crt0_gnu.asm
00256    file, and that startup code will setup stacks and data */
00257 int main(void)
00258 {
00259     return c_entry();
00260 }

00265 * @brief                Reports the name of the source file and the source line number
00266 *                               where the CHECK_PARAM error has occurred.
00267 * @param[in]    file Pointer to the source file name
00268 * @param[in]    line assert_param error line source number
00269 * @return               None
00270 *******************************************************************************/
00271 void check_failed(uint8_t *file, uint32_t line)
00272 {
00273         /* User can add his own implementation to report the file name and line number,
00274          ex: printf("Wrong parameters value: file %s on line %d\r\n", file, line) */
00275 
00276         /* Infinite loop */
00277         while(1);
00278 }
